creditline: The John R. Van Derlip Fund
department: Chinese, South and Southeast Asian Art
description: Scroll hanging of embroidered blue silk mounted in brocade border.  The scene represents three taoist gods of Longevity, Shou-hsing (left); of Public office Lu-hsing (center); of Happiness, Fushen (right) with three boy attendants carrying objects of rank and authority.  The embroidery and blending of colors is of high quality in this panel, which is said to have been purchased from the imperial collection.
text: This embroidered silk panel, mounted as a hanging scroll depicts three Daoist gods. The God of Wealth, lu, stands in the center with the God of Longevity, shou, on his left and the God of Happiness, fu, on his right. The three attendants carry symbolic items: a ceremonial scepter called a ruyi (symbolizing good fortune and happiness), a spear-battle axe and seal (symbolizing official position), and a piece of coral (symbolizing riches.)
title: Hanging Representing Three Daoist Gods
